ygData.subject: change to CVS directory structure coming soon

From: David Goodwin <dgoodwin@...>
Subject: change to CVS directory structure coming soon
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=44728387; y=7s1qgyacjrRebBfp2FFLOWxyeyIKCg5dxBzpDWJwOGdZ
X-Yahoo-Profile: dggoodwin

This message is for those of you who are compiling Cantera from  
source code from CVS...

I am about to make some significant changes to the directory  
structure in the Cantera source tree, specifically in directory  
Cantera/src.  This is necessary to clean up some dependency issues  
between different Cantera libraries, and will result in a layout that  
is much easier to understand.

I have tagged the current version of the repository with the tag  
"Release_1_7_0_final".  You can continue to check out the code with  
the current directory structure using this tag.

Later today I will begin moving files in the repository. The  
reorganized version will be 1.7.1.  If you are building Cantera with  
Visual Studio under Windows, hold off on updating from CVS until I  
have a chance to recreate the Visual Studio project files.

Soon after this reorganization is complete, some additional  
capabilities will be added, including the ability to access new  
equations of state from Python or MATLAB (e.g. liquid electrolytes),  
and a much improved ability to specify time-dependent attributes in  
reactor networks.
